products.name: deploy-arch-ibm-watsonx-data
products.label: Cloud automation for watsonx.data
products.short_description: Creates and configures an instance of IBM watsonx.data.
products.long_description: With [IBM watsonx.data](https://www.ibm.com/products/watsonx-data), you can manage and analyze all of your enterprise data, regardless of format, in a unified platform. It's support for open data formats and machine learning libraries makes that data directly accessible for AI workloads. In addition to watsonx.data, this deployable architecture includes optional tools for key encryption and observability, giving you everything you need to manage your watsonx.data deployment.

features.title: watsonx.data instance
features.description: Get started with watsonx.data by creating and configuring an instance. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/watsonxdata/index.html).

features.title: Optional encryption with Key Protect
features.description: Use watsonx.data with Key Protect, which encrypts and secures your enterprise data. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/key-protect?topic=key-protect-about).

features.title: Optional observability tools
features.description: Use watsonx.data with [Cloud automation for Observability](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/7a4d68b4-cf8b-40cd-a3d1-f49aff526eb3/architecture/deploy-arch-ibm-observability-a3137d28-79e0-479d-8a24-758ebd5a0eab-global), which provides monitoring and logging capabilities to deliver deep operational insights into your watsonx.data deployment.

products.support_details: This product is in the community registry, support is handled through the [original repo](https://github.com/terraform-ibm-modules/terraform-ibm-watsonx-data). If you experience issues kindly open an issue [here](https://github.com/terraform-ibm-modules/terraform-ibm-watsonx-data/issues). Please note that this product is not currently supported through the IBM Cloud Support Center.

iam_permissions.notes: Viewer access is required in the resource group you want to provision in.
[Optional] Required for consuming Account Configuration deployable architecture which creates resource group.

iam_permissions.service_name: All Identity and Access enabled services
iam_permissions.notes: [Optional] Required for consuming Account Configuration deployable architecture which creates resource group with account settings.
Required to create an instance of watsonx.data
[Optional] Required for enabling KMS encryption in Observability deployable architecture and for encrypting the watsonx.data instance using Key Protect.
[Optional] Required for enabling Hyper Protect Crypto Services in Observability deployable architecture and for encrypting the watsonx.data instance using Hyper Protect Crypto Services.
[Optional] Required for configuring Activity Tracker event routing to Cloud Object Storage bucket and Cloud Logs.
[Optional] Required for creating a new instance of Cloud Monitoring.
[Optional] Required for creating a new instance of Cloud Logs.
[Optional] Required if you are deploying Cloud automation for Object Storage.

features.description: Configured to use IBM secure by default standards, but can be edited to fit your use case.

diagrams.description:
This deployable architecture provisions a watsonx.data instance on IBM Cloud, with the option to use additional services to support enterprise-grade requirements.

It enables encryption for the watsonx.data instance by provisioning an instance of IBM Key Protect, where a Key Ring and associated Key are created to manage encryption through IBM Cloud Key Management Services (KMS). You can use an existing KMS instance instead.

Optionally, you can also configure observability services, which includes IBM Cloud Activity Tracker Event Routing to monitor how users and applications interact with watsonx.data, supporting compliance and auditability. Enable IBM Cloud logs to collect, view, and analyze platform logs related to watsonx.data to gain visibility into usage patterns through active tasks and queries. While IBM Cloud Monitoring captures essential metrics such as CPU and memory usage, helping you proactively monitor system performance and resource consumption.

configuration.description: When set to `true`, the IBM Cloud Monitoring instance is configured to collect platform metrics from the specified region. ⚠️ You can configure only one instance of the IBM Cloud Monitoring service per region to collect platform metrics in that location. Check with the account or service administrator if another monitoring instance is already configured. You might not have permissions to see all monitoring instances in the region. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/monitoring?topic=monitoring-platform_metrics_enabling).

To manage platform logs that are generated by IBM Cloud services in a region of IBM Cloud, you must create a tenant in each region that you operate. Pass a list of regions to create a tenant in. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/logs-router?topic=logs-router-about-platform-logs).

dependencies.name: deploy-arch-ibm-account-infra-base
dependencies.description: Cloud automation for account configuration organizes your IBM Cloud account with a ready-made set of resource groups by default. And, when you enable the "with Account Settings" option, it also applies baseline security and governance settings.

dependencies.name: deploy-arch-ibm-kms
dependencies.description: Enable Cloud automation for Key Protect to use your own managed encryption keys. If disabled, IBM Cloud's default service-managed encryption is used.

dependencies.name: deploy-arch-ibm-cloud-logs
dependencies.description: Provision and configure IBM Cloud Logs for analysing logs generated by the Watsonx data instance.
dependencies.name: deploy-arch-ibm-observability
dependencies.description: Configure IBM Cloud Logs, IBM Cloud Monitoring and IBM Cloud Activity Tracker Event Routing for analyzing logs and metrics generated by the watsonx.data instance.

dependencies.name: deploy-arch-ibm-activity-tracker
dependencies.description: Configure a new IBM Cloud Logs instance for viewing activity tracking events generated by the Watsonx data instance.
